results.title: Out of breath
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Don Anderson and Phillip Mark-Law
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary about occupational asthma. A cabinet maker is faced with the difficult choice between continuing to work in a dusty environment or improving his health.

results.title: Out of bounds: Teenage sexual harassment
results.creator_credit: Coronet, Donald R. Ham and Yvonne Harper
results.brief_description: Aimed at teenagers this documentary explores what constitutes sexual harassment and what can be done to combat it. Sexual harassment is defined as unwanted tension of a sexual nature-attitude is portrayed as the biggest contributor. Issues such as what is defined as bad habits, whistling and joking etc and what to do if your the victim of sexual harassment are explored. The video also offers a solution to the problem- recognising that harassment has taken place and communication to recognise the boundaries of a relationship. The material is presented through a fictional case study which is narrated and commented on.

results.title: Out of battle: Wilfred Owen and Siegfried Sassoon
results.brief_description: Documentary: Brings to life some of the works of British First World War poets Wilfred Owen and Siegfried Sasson. Poems featured are “Dulce et decorum est”, “Anthem for doomed youth” and “The send off” by William Owen and “They” by Siegfried Sasson.

results.title: Out of Africa [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Mirage Enterprises and Sydney Pollack
results.brief_description: Meryl Streep stars as Karen Blixen whose love affair with Africa began when she and her husband Baron Von Blixen (Klaus-Maria Brandauer) went to Kenya in 1914. Despite her disastrous marriage and the failure of her coffee plantation, her passion for Africa never died. Robert Redford is cast as her lover, Denys Finch-Hatton. Based on the books of Isak Dinesen (Karen Blixen’s pen name) “Out of Africa”, “Shadows on the grass” and “Letters from Africa” by Isak Dinesen; “Isak Dinesen: the life of a storyteller” by Judith Thurman; “Silence will speak” by Errol Trzebinski. Her powers of observation and gift for storytelling revealed the empathy she felt for the people of Kenya and her attraction to the land. (Academy awards 1986: Best Picture, Best Director, Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Cinematography, Best Original Score (John Barry), Best Art Direction and Best Sound)

results.title: Out of a Chinese painting brush (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Produced by the Harmon Foundation in cooperation with the China Institute in America, this film shows us a famous Chinese artist, Chang Shu-Chi at work with a paint-brush. Photographed at actual speed, the film reveals the speed and grace of his technique.

results.title: Out live = Bichunmoo
results.creator_credit: Taewan Entertainment, Lee Tae-Won, Yoo Jung-Ho and Kim Young-Jun
results.brief_description: The daughter of a concubine falls into a forbidden romance with a fearsome warrior of lowly descent. With her beloved feared dead, Sullie agrees to marry an evil Chinese warlord, under pressure from her corrupted father. Director Kim Young-Jun combines sweeping grandeur with exciting martial arts, and wire-work special effects (conjuring “Crouching tiger, hidden dragon”), to create a historical action picture. Based on the manga by Korean writer Kim Hye-rin. Cast includes: Shin Hyun-Joon and Kim Hee-Seon.

results.title: Out here
results.creator_credit: Warrnambool (Vic.). Early Childhood Development Complex and Ross Landers
results.brief_description: Shows some of the services of the Early Childhood Development Complex, Warrnambool, which provides for children both normal and handicapped, who would otherwise suffer from isolation in Victoria’s south-west region. Services include loans of toys and books, a travelling medical service, a Family Day Care group, and a support group for handicapped children and their parents.

results.title: Out for a change: addressing homophobia in women's sports
results.brief_description: A documentary which addresses the issues of homophobia in women’s sports. In particular, homophobia is seen as a political tool which is used to control the lucrative sports industry. Interviews with aspiring young women athletes, coaches, administrators and professional athletes such as Zina Garrison-Jackson and Martina Navratilova offer a rare insight into the insidious nature of homophobia and how athletes can confront and deal with the problem.

results.title: Out
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: A documentary report on a people’s flight to freedom and of the problems Hungarian escapees face in finding a new home and a new land. Shot in Austria by UN cameramen, the film contains scenes of actual escapes across the border. The film is a moving document, telling the story of a mother and two boys and their search for a new homeland. Powerful and dramatic use of music which was recorded in one of the ninety refugee camps in Austria and haunting images combine to capture the danger and the desperation faced by these people.
